content:
From: Tobias Nipkow <nipkow@in.tum.de>
Dear readers of this list,

Please note that starting with the new year, the only valid address for this
list is the above one (which most of you will use anyway). Addresses like
informatik.tu-muenchen.de no longer work because TUM has switched them off.

Tobias

smime.p7s

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
On 07/01/2025 11:44, Tobias Nipkow wrote:

Dear readers of this list,

Please note that starting with the new year, the only valid address for this
list is the above one (which most of you will use anyway). Addresses like
informatik.tu-muenchen.de no longer work because TUM has switched them off.

What is the canonical Web interface now?

Makarius

From: Tobias Nipkow <nipkow@in.tum.de>
Sorry, I don't get the question. I use thunderbird.

Tobias

On 07/01/2025 15:47, Makarius wrote:

On 07/01/2025 11:44, Tobias Nipkow wrote:

Dear readers of this list,

Please note that starting with the new year, the only valid address for this
list is the above one (which most of you will use anyway). Addresses like
informatik.tu-muenchen.de no longer work because TUM has switched them off.

What is the canonical Web interface now?

Makarius

smime.p7s

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
On 07/01/2025 16:05, Tobias Nipkow wrote:

Sorry, I don't get the question. I use thunderbird.

Mailman has a canonical Web interface to manage it, e.g. to
subscribe/unsubscribe, change configuration etc.

We used to have this one, but it no longer works:
https://mailmanbroy.informatik.tu-muenchen.de/mailman/listinfo/isabelle-dev

Here is a still working example:
https://lists.inf.ed.ac.uk/mailman/listinfo/polyml

Makarius

From: Roland Lutz <rlutz@hedmen.org>
On Tue, 7 Jan 2025, Makarius wrote:

Mailman has a canonical Web interface to manage it, e.g. to
subscribe/unsubscribe, change configuration etc.

We used to have this one, but it no longer works:
https://mailmanbroy.informatik.tu-muenchen.de/mailman/listinfo/isabelle-dev

Here is a still working example:
https://lists.inf.ed.ac.uk/mailman/listinfo/polyml

https://mailman46.in.tum.de/mailman/listinfo/isabelle-dev

The "isabelle-dev mailing list" link on the Isabelle website still works,
the "subscribe" and "archive" links point to informatik.tu-muenchen.de
addresses and should probably be updated.

Roland

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
On 07/01/2025 16:56, Roland Lutz wrote:

https://mailman46.in.tum.de/mailman/listinfo/isabelle-dev

Thanks, at least that is a working Web interface.

The address looks not canonical in terms of the TUM/CIT DNS restructuring, though.

Makarius
